div.p: I meet different people every day; I do lots of different treatments that can be from spray tanning to an eyebrow wax.
It is getting to know your client as well, keeping record cards, you know noting if they’ve been on holiday or something
so you can bring it up the next time they come in. Being professional, also like when it’s your salon you need to make sure
the health and safety checks are done, the cleanliness of the salon, the bookkeeping, the appointment making;
there’s lots to do as a beautician. If it was an admin day it would literally just be 9am-5pm, you know core hours
but obviously working for yourself in your own business it can be all day every day so when the clients are there I’ll be working
and if they’re not obviously I’ll be using my time doing something else so like I could be working 8:30am-8:30pm because I’ve got a busy day
but then I’ll also be taking bookings whenever I’m getting people contacting me so it is 24 hours really, all the time, constant.
